definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Durge would take great satisfaction in being able to kill legions of his sworn enemies.
sentences.chinese: 德奇將從殺死整團整團的死敵中獲得極大的滿足。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

sentences.english: But the external perception of a city being left behind by its nearest rival remains.
sentences.chinese: 但是外界對它落後於近鄰死敵的觀念依然存在。

sentences.english: Leimer will not continue to fly long - haul away the sworn enemy of Stuttgart.
sentences.chinese: 而不萊梅則要繼續長途飛行客場挑戰死敵斯圖加特。

sentences.english: Adams and I were deadly enemies.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯和我是不共戴天的死敵。

sentences.english: It comes down to this, Nineveh, the city to be absolved was the murderer of his family.
sentences.chinese: 這座他要布赦免的尼尼微城是毀滅他家族的死敵。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

definition: hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to fight with all one's might
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to charge and break through enemy lines
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
